returns.blockNumber_: The block number that was checkpointed, which is always                      `block.number - 1`.

params._blockNumber: The block number to load the block hash and timestamp for.

returns.blockInfo_: The block hash and timestamp for the given block number.

checkpoint().notice: Stores a block hash for the previous block number.

load(uint256).notice: Loads a block hash for a given block number, assuming that the block number         has been stored in the oracle.

checkpoint().notice: Stores a block hash for the previous block number.

load(uint256).notice: Loads a block hash for a given block number, assuming that the block number         has been stored in the oracle.

Checkpoint(uint256,bytes32,uint64).notice: Emitted when a block is checkpointed.

BlockHashNotPresent().notice: Thrown when a block hash is attempted to be loaded that has not been stored.

userdoc.notice: Stores a map of block numbers => block hashes for use in dispute resolution

returns.blockNumber_: The block number that was checkpointed, which is always                      `block.number - 1`.

params._blockNumber: The block number to load the block hash and timestamp for.

returns.blockInfo_: The block hash and timestamp for the given block number.

documentation.text: @notice Emitted when a block is checkpointed.
@notice Maps block numbers to block hashes and timestamps

@title BlockOracle
 @notice Stores a map of block numbers => block hashes for use in dispute resolution
